short.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: Press Ctrl+Z (Command+Z on Mac) to reopen a closed tab.

long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
With this extension, you can press Ctrl+Z (Command+Z on Mac) to reopen a closed tab. Ctrl+Shift+T will still work. You should install this if you're used to Ctrl+Z to reopen closed tabs and/or you don't like stretching your fingers to type Ctrl+Shit+T. Although, honestly, I don't care if you use this or not.

Known bugs: When you start Chrome after it has been completely closed, pressing Ctrl+Z won't reopen closed tabs from the last time Chrome was running, but Ctrl+Shift+T will.

FAQ:

Q: I want it to use a different keyboard shortcut!!
A: That's great. Do it yourself.

Q: I found a bug, please fix it!!
A: No. Fix it yourself.

Q: I want feature X!!
A: Too bad. Add it yourself.
